__comment: This section is for documentation purposes only and should be ignored by the application.

_documentation.default_format: Specifies the default logging format. Available options: asc, blf, csv, log, trc.
_documentation.default_can_interface: Specifies the default CAN interface channel. Usually can0 or can1.

_format_descriptions.asc: ASC (ASCII) format, suitable for human-readable logs and easy post-processing.
_format_descriptions.blf: BLF (Binary Logging Format), compact binary format for efficient storage, often used in Vector tools.
_format_descriptions.csv: CSV (Comma-Separated Values), versatile and widely supported format for data exchange and analysis.
_format_descriptions.log: LOG, a textual logging format used primarily within the Linux can-utils suite.
_format_descriptions.trc: TRC, Trace format, typically used with PEAK-System tools for detailed analysis.
